results.title: Yehudi Menuhin and his guru
results.brief_description: One of the most famous practitioners of Yoga today is Yehudi Menuhin who discusses its teachings and aims with David Attenborough. Taking part with him is his Guru (or spiritual teacher) who joins in the discussion and demonstrates some of the unusual exercises prescribed by Yoga.

results.title: Yehudi Menuhin - Brahms violin concerto in D Major, Op. 77
results.creator_credit: Bruno Monsaingeon, Lexi Godfrey, VEB Deutsche Schallplatten and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: Recorded live at the Gewandhaus in Leipzig on 2nd September 1982. This is a most exquisite performance by Yehudi Menuhin, the internationally acclaimed violinist who is recognised worldwide for his outstanding brilliance. The concerto is preceded by a personal introduction by Yehudi Menuhin and two pieces of unaccompanied Bach make up the encores. He is supported by the Gewandhaus Orchestra conducted by Kurt Masur.

results.title: Yeats country
results.creator_credit: Patrick Carey, Joe Mendoza and Angus Films
results.brief_description: Yeats had a deep love for the countryside of Western Ireland. This film, commemorating the centenary of the birth of the poet, portrays his feelings in terms of his poems, as well as creating its own poetry out of the Irish landscape.

results.title: Years of lightning, day of drums
results.brief_description: Gregory Peck narrates this film about John F. Kennedy’s two years and ten months in the White House. His goals and achievements are contrasted with scenes of the world in mourning after his assassination while visiting the town of Dallas, Texas.

results.title: Year of the Horse: Neil Young and Crazy Horse live
results.creator_credit: Jim Jarmusch, L Johnson and Shakey Pictures
results.brief_description: Spanning a career of more that three decades, legendary performer Neil Young and his band Crazy Horse ‘crank it up’ in rockin’ live concert documentary footage of an extensive tour in 1996. Watch interviews with the band: guitarist Frank “Poncho” Sampedro, bassist Billy Talbot, drummer Ralph Molina and singer/guitarist Neil Young. Mixed with intimate back-stage and ‘on-the-road’ moments from the 1970s through to the 1990s, director Jim Jarmusch takes the viewer on a musical pilgrimage discovering the intensity of live performance and staying-power of these classic rock compositions by Young and the Horse. Shot on Super8, 16mm and Hi-8 Video.

results.title: Year of the Green Centre
results.creator_credit: Ken Taylor, Barry Paine, BBC and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: In July 1973, Warren Bonython and Charles McGovern became the first people to cross the Simpson Desert on foot. In their tracks, followed an ABC/BBC film crew who describe the harsh terrain, the animal life and the lush vegetation that followed one of the wettest years in the region.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ken Taylor, Barry Paine, BBC and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Year of the Dogs
results.creator_credit: Michael Cordell and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: Football is a game capable of inspiring incredible emotional responses from both players and supporters. Michael Cordell captures the highs and lows of the 1996 season as seen from players and two loyal fans. Key players are followed through their injuries, as are the politics of management. What emerges is a team of players and supporters united by their love for the game and the Footscray Football Club.

results.title: Yarra bank
results.brief_description: An impression of the regular Sunday afternoon meeting of “Soap Box Orators” on the bank of the Yarra River in Melbourne. The film is concerned with the characters that make up the gathering, a number of them have been attending the meetings over a period of many years, and some of the speakers have become, well-known identities from their appearances there. The commentary to the film is a series of anecdotes on the “Yarra bank” and its people as told by Percy Lightfoot, a regular visitor to the meetings since 1924. Credits: Sound recordist, Ron Green; Sound editor, Glen Pirani.

results.title: Yarn and cloth construction
results.brief_description: Shows the carding board, the spinning wheel and the hand loom, to demonstrate the process of converting raw fibres into woven cloth; high-magnification photography is used to illustrate the state of fibres in each process.
